results.name: Aleksandr Popov
results.bio: Aleksandr Popov was a physicist and electrical engineer acclaimed in Russia as the inventor of radio.

results.name: Alexandre Ribot
results.bio: Alexandre Ribot was a French statesman of the Third Republic who was four times premier of France.

results.name: Bertrand Barère
results.bio: Bertrand Barère was a leading member of the Committee of Public Safety that ruled Revolutionary France during the period of the Jacobin dictatorship (1793–94); his stringent policies against those suspected.

results.name: Brecker, Michael Leonard
results.bio: Brecker, Michael Leonard was an American tenor saxophonist, whose stark, jagged, yet driving jazz style influenced many tenor saxophonists in the late 20th and early 21st centuries.

results.name: Carlos Luis de Borbón, count de Montemolín
results.bio: Carlos Luis de Borbón, count de Montemolín was the second Carlist, or Bourbon traditionalist, Spanish pretender (as Charles VI) who twice attempted unsuccessfully to seize the throne and who by perpetuating.

results.name: Charles III
results.bio: Charles III was a Frankish king and emperor, whose fall in 887 marked the final disintegration of the empire of Charlemagne.

results.name: Chiang Ching-kuo
results.bio: Chiang Ching-kuo was the son of Chiang Kai-shek (Jiang Jieshi), and his successor as leader of the Republic of China (Taiwan).

results.name: Christian Magnus Falsen
results.bio: Christian Magnus Falsen was a nationalist political leader, generally regarded as the author of the Norwegian constitution.

results.name: Constantin Siegwart-Müller
results.bio: Constantin Siegwart-Müller was a Swiss politician who headed the Ultramontane Party at Lucerne and became the leader of the dissident Sonderbund.

results.name: Donny Hathaway
results.bio: Donny Hathaway was a soul music singer, composer, and keyboardist whose influential work blends elements of rhythm and blues (R&B), jazz, and gospel music and helped lay the groundwork for American soul.

results.name: Edgar J. Goodspeed
results.bio: Edgar J.

results.name: Edmund Spenser
results.bio: Edmund Spenser was an English poet whose long allegorical poem The Faerie Queene is one of the greatest in the English language.

results.name: Edna Purviance
results.bio: Edna Purviance was an American movie actress of the silent film era, who played opposite Charlie Chaplin in more than 30 films, including such classic short works as The Tramp (1915), Easy Street (1917),.

results.name: Ellen Stewart
results.bio: Ellen Stewart was an American theatre director who founded (1961) and for nearly 50 years remained the visionary artistic director of the seminal La MaMa Experimental Theatre Club, an Off-Off-Broadway.

results.name: Ernie Kovacs
results.bio: Ernie Kovacs was an American television comedian.

results.name: Fabian Gottlieb von Bellingshausen
results.bio: Fabian Gottlieb von Bellingshausen was a Russian explorer who led the second expedition to circumnavigate Antarctica (1819–21) and for whom the Bellingshausen Sea, an area of the Antarctic waters, was.

results.name: Felisberto Hernández
results.bio: Felisberto Hernández was one of the most original Latin American short-story writers.

results.name: Frederick
results.bio: Frederick (III) was a German king from 1314 to 1326, also duke of Austria (as Frederick III) from 1308, the second son of the German king Albert I.

results.name: George Fox
results.bio: George Fox was an English preacher and missionary and founder of the Society of Friends (or Quakers).
